newsitem.title: JAPAN: Mitsui Fudosan seen posting current loss--paper.
newsitem.headline: Mitsui Fudosan seen posting current loss--paper.

text.p: Mitsui Fudosan Co Ltd is expected to post a parent current loss of more than 40 billion yen in 1996/97 but the loss is likely to be covered by the sale of shares it holds in Oriental Land Co Ltd, the operator of Tokyo Disneyland, a Japanese daily said on Thursday.
The Nihon Keizai Shimbun attributed the expected loss to sales of unprofitable properties.
It would be Mitsui Fudosan's first parent current loss since its listing in 1949, the paper said.

In order to post a parent net profit in 1996/97, which ends on March 31, Mitsui is expected to post an extraordinary profit of about 50 billion yen from the sale of shares it holds in Oriental Land, which is planning to list its shares on the Tokyo Stock Exchange in mid-December, the paper said.

Brokerage officials have said that Oriental Land would go public in mid-December but the company itself has declined comment. In 1995/96, Mitsui posted a parent current profit of 8.41 billion yen and net profit of 6.94 billion yen.
A spokesman for Mitsui was not immediately available for comment on the report.
